page.title: 10HISTORY OF BATTLE ABBEY CONT
page.content: {WEBSTER.}IN 1857 IT WAS BOUGHT BY THE {DUKE OF CLEVELAND}WHO SOLD IT BACK TO THE WEBSTERS IN 1901.IN 1922 IT WAS LEASED TO{BATTLE ABBEY SCHOOL}WHO STILL OCCUPY IT.THE ESTATE WAS BOUGHT BY THE{DEPARTMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT IN 1976.CERTAIN PARTS OF THE ESTATE ARE OPEN TO THE PUBLIC. TODAY THERE ARE FEW REMAINS OF THE {ABBEY BUILDINGS;}THE ABBOT'S HOUSE IS OCCUPIED BY THE SCHOOL,BUT THE DORMITORY RANGE, WHICH IS STILL STANDING,IS OPEN TO VISITORS.THERE ARE THREE VAULTED ROOMS,WHICH WERE PROBABLY USED AS LIVING ACCOMMODATION AND A DORMITORY ABOVE.THE REREDORTER,WHICH WAS RECENTLY EXCAVATED,IS JOINED ONTO THE DORMITORY AND THE INFIRMARY,THE SITE OF WHICH IS UNCERTAIN,WAS PROBABLY BEHIND THIS. THE PARLOUR AND THE CHAPTER-HOUSE WERE ALSO EXCAVATED BUT ONLY THEIR
